name: Shrimp Ceviche (Ecuadorian)
instructions: Cook shrimp in boiling water for 2-3 minutes. Drain and cool.
Slice onion, tomato, and bell pepper thinly.
Juice the limes and mix with shrimp and vegetables.
Add chopped cilantro, salt, and pepper.
Let it marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes before serving.

name: Peanut Sauce Rice Noodles
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package instructions.
In a bowl, mix peanut butter, soy sauce, sesame oil, minced garlic, chili flakes, and water to make the sauce.
Toss the noodles in the sauce until well coated.
Serve warm or cold.

name: Chow Mein
instructions: Cook noodles according to package instructions.
Sauté garlic and ginger in oil.
Add shredded cabbage, carrot, and bell pepper. Stir-fry until tender.
Add cooked noodles, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Toss to combine.

name: Fried Rice
instructions: Sauté garlic and ginger in oil.
Add mixed vegetables and cook until tender.
Push vegetables to the side and scramble eggs in the same pan.
Add cooked rice and soy sauce. Mix well and cook until heated through.

name: Quinoa Salad
instructions: Cook quinoa according to package instructions.
Dice cucumber, tomato, and avocado.
Mix quinoa with vegetables.
Whisk olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Pour over salad and toss.

name: Tigrillo (Ecuadorian)
instructions: Fry plantains until golden. Mash them.
Sauté onions and tomatoes.
Scramble eggs and mix with mashed plantains and sautéed vegetables.
Add cheese and stir until melted.

name: Carbonara Pasta
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
Sauté pancetta and garlic until crispy.
Whisk eggs and Parmesan in a bowl.
Toss cooked pasta with pancetta, then mix in egg and cheese mixture.
Serve immediately.

name: Risotto
instructions: Sauté onion in butter until soft.
Add rice and toast for 2 minutes.
Pour in wine and cook until absorbed.
Add broth one ladle at a time, stirring until absorbed.
Stir in Parmesan and serve.

name: Pesto Pasta
instructions: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
Blend basil, olive oil, pine nuts, garlic, and Parmesan to make pesto.
Toss pasta with pesto and serve.

name: Banana Bread
instructions: Mash bananas and mix with melted butter.
Add sugar, eggs, and mix well.
Stir in flour and baking soda.
Pour into a greased loaf pan and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1 hour.

name: Cauliflower Cream Soup
instructions: Sauté onion in butter until soft.
Add cauliflower and broth. Simmer until tender.
Blend until smooth.
Stir in milk and season with salt and pepper.

name: Burritos
instructions: Fill tortillas with rice, beans, cheese, salsa, and avocado slices.
Fold the sides and roll tightly.
Serve warm.

name: Overnight Oats
instructions: Mix oats, milk, honey, and chia seeds in a jar.
Refrigerate overnight.
Top with berries before serving.

name: Encebollado
instructions: Boil tuna in water with salt, then remove and shred.
In a separate pot, sauté onions and tomatoes with achiote and cumin.
Add yuca and cooking broth, then simmer until tender.
Return shredded tuna, season to taste, and serve hot with cilantro.

name: Bolón de Verde
instructions: Boil or fry plantains until soft.
Mash them with butter and salt, then mix with cheese and chicharrón.
Form into balls and optionally fry until golden brown.
Serve warm with coffee or eggs.

name: Pancakes
instructions: Mix ingredients
Cook on a hot griddle

name: Wafles
instructions: Mix ingredients
Cook on a hot griddle
